tours.title: Sightseeing tour with english speaking driver
tours.description: A complete vision of Paris in a comfortable private car around the city. Meet your driver at the hotel and enjoy a 3h30min panoramic sightseeing of Paris highlights. Discover the city and admire its major attractions: The Champs-Elysees, Arc de Triomphe, Eiffel Tower, Opera, Trocadero, Invalides, Concorde Square, Vendome Square, Notre-Dame cathedral, Montmartre, Louvre museum, Madeleine church...

options.name_option: Car/Van with english speaking driver. Price per car/van

tours.title: Seine River panoramic cruise
tours.description: See the iconic monuments of Paris from the water on a 1-hour shared sightseeing cruise along the River Seine. Your driver will meet you at the hotel and drop you at embarkment point to enjoy this warm and friendly cruise experience, on comfortable sized boats. This guided cruise offers unique stories, anecdotes and discussions as you discover Paris and its monuments and museums. After the cruise, your driver will take you back to your hotel.

tours.title: Vintage car tour by iconic Citroën 2CV
tours.description: Experience a fun and lighthearted sightseeing tour in a vintage Citroën 2CV car. This classic French car is known for its unique design and has become an iconic symbol of France. One of the highlights of the Citroën 2CV is its convertible roof which allows you to enjoy an open-top experience and take in the sights and sounds of Paris in a unique way. The knowledgeable drivers often share interesting anecdotes, historical facts, and local insights about the places.

tours.title: Walking guided city tour by metro
tours.description: Explore the icons of Paris with a private local guide and a walking tour around the main areas and corners of the city. Paris is often referred to as the 'City of Light' (La Ville Lumière) due to its historical importance in the Age of Enlightenment and its early adoption of street lighting. The Seine River flows through the heart of Paris and its banks are dotted with picturesque bridges and monuments. Feel the Parisian lifestyle and city the rhythm of the city by strolling along its beautiful avenues, streets, gardens and different quarters each with its own personality.

tours.title: Sightseeing tour with english speaking driver
tours.description: From your hotel in a private van, enjoy a 3-hour sightseeing tour with our English-speaking driver who will show you the highlights of Nice such as La Promenade des Anglais, the iconic boardwalk offering breathtaking views of the Mediterranean Sea, the Russian church, the Cimiez hill & Matisse museum, the Art promenade, Louis Nucera library, the Modern Art Museum, the old town and finally the panoramic view from Mount-Boron.

options.name_option: Van with english speaking driver. Price per van

tours.title: Walking guided city tour
tours.description: Explore the charming narrow streets and colorful buildings of Nice's Old Town with a private guided walking tour. Learn about the history of the area, visit the famous Cours Saleya market and discover landmarks such as the Nice Cathedral and the Lascaris Palace. Take a leisurely stroll along the iconic Promenade des Anglais, which stretches along the Mediterranean coastline. Enjoy panoramic views of the sea, learn about the history of the promenade and discover landmarks such as the Hotel Negresco and the Albert I Garden.

tours.title: Eze, Monaco & Monte Carlo day trip
tours.description: Escape from Nice and admire the Mediterranean coast and its iconic villages with this private day trip. We will stop at Eze, a beautiful village perched high on a cliff overlooking the French Riviera with many artisan workshops. You will visit the Fragonard perfume factory to learn about the process of extracting essential oils. Then, a stop at Monaco old town and the picturesque Port Hercules followed by a stroll through the glamorous heart of Monte Carlo will allow you to experience a glimpse of luxury.

options.name_option: Van with english speaking driver. Price per van

tours.title: French Riviera markets, countryside & lunch day trip
tours.description: Discover the gorgeous landscapes, culinary finesse and artistic heritage of the French Riviera countryside. Immerse yourself in the region's natural beauty, picturesque landscapes of vineyards and olive groves dotted with charming villages. Exploring the markets of the French Riviera is a delightful way to experience the region's vibrant culture. Each market has its own atmosphere and specialties and you can get a taste of the area's culinary richness by enjoying a gourmet lunch at a local restaurant.

options.name_option: Van with english speaking driver. Price per van
Gourmet lunch 3 courses with wine. Price per pax

tours.title: Food tours
tours.description: Indulge your tastebuds and explore Paris' thriving gastronomic scene with this gourmet walking tours. During your 3-hour tour, follow your expert guide to local foodie hotspots such as markets, cheese shops, bakeries, and patisseries. Enjoy delicious tastings carefully tailored to the season and gain insight into France's culinary culture and heritage.
tours.observations: Shared activity. Min. 2 pax. Not available on bank holidays, Christmas weeks, July & August.

tours.title: French wine and cheese tasting
tours.description: Enjoy an immersive experience in the wonderful world of wine on this tasting tour in Paris. During your 1.5-hour tasting experience, your host - an expert 'caviste' - takes you on a journey into traditional French winemaking. Taste three varieties of wine and two types of cheese, understand the importance of terroir and learn how to pair different wines and cheeses for appealing flavor combinations that suit your palate.
tours.observations: Shared activity. Min. 2 pax / Max. 8 pax. Non-operating: 19, 28 & 29 Apr, 01 May, 10 & 14 Jul.

tours.title: Wine Museum with gourmet french lunch
tours.description: At the bend of the Trocadero, discover in a sumptuous mansion of the 17th century, the Wine Museum and its permanent exhibition, its restaurant, wine bar and its tasting rooms. Initiate yourself to the art of wine tasting or learn how to make your own wine! The Museum, an exceptional permanent collection of more than 2200 objects, presented in a historic place of more than 1000 m2 and incredibly preserved: the old quarries and vaulted rooms of the convent of Passy which were exploited in the 13th and 18th centuries.
tours.observations: Half day package / Price per pax: Wine Museum Experience & 1 wine glass tasting. Gourmet lunch 3 courses & 3 glasses of wine.

tours.title: Paris Mon Amour
tours.description: Soak up the splendor of Paris in an unforgettable evening that includes magnificent views from the Eiffel Tower, an exquisite dinner cruise on the River Seine and a flamboyant cancan show at the famous Moulin Rouge, symbol of the artistic and lively spirit of Paris.

tours.title: Côte de Nuits & Côte de Beaune day trip
tours.description: Travel to the heart of the Côte de Nuits and Côte de Beaune wine regions, explore villages and stop at 3 family-owned wineries. You will be accompanied by a wine expert guide who will introduce you to the grapes, terroirs and climates of Burgundy. You will enjoy an explanation of the work in the vineyard throughout the year and all its secrets. The tastings (about 18 wines tasted) are exclusive and private. The gastronomic experience will be at a traditional restaurant (one of the best in the area) or at a family-run winery.

tours.title: Walking guided city tour
tours.description: Visit the city of Bordeaux with a passion local guide for history, but also culture, whose goal is to help you discover some of the wonders of this city. The historic center of Bordeaux is a UNESCO World Heritage Site, celebrated for its elegant 18th-century architecture. Highlights include the Place de la Bourse, a magnificent square facing the Garonne River, and the Grand Theatre de Bordeaux, an exquisite neoclassical opera house. The city also features beautiful public gardens, such as the Jardin Public and the Parc Bordelais.

The region's natural beauty has inspired artists, writers, and travelers for centuries. During this tour you will visit a beautiful wine estate.

tours.title: Royal experience: Versailles day tour
tours.description: With your personal driver and guide, learn about the famous Palace of Versailles. The palace is renowned for its lavish architecture, exquisite interior design, and extensive gardens. Louis XIV, in the late 17th century, transformed Versailles into a symbol of absolute monarchy and French power. During his reign, the palace became the center of political and social life. Versailles was the seat of the French monarchy until the French Revolution in 1789.

tours.title: Angelina iconic tea experience
tours.description: The history of Maison Angelina dates back to the beginning of the 20th century. In 1903, the Austrian confectioner Anton Rumpelmayer and his son René founded a tea room called 'Angelina' at 226 rue de Rivoli, in honor of his daughter-in-law, named Angelina. Nowadays is the best tea room in Paris. Enjoy the emblematic and glamorous tea time in Paris.

tours.title: Eiffel Tower skip the line
tours.description: Admire the Eiffel Tower with this skip-the-line tour. Meet your driver at your hotel to visit this iconic landmark of Paris which was completed in 1889 and was initially built as the entrance arch for the 1889 Universal Exhibition, held in Paris to commemorate the 100th anniversary of the French Revolution. The tower was designed by the French engineer Gustave Eiffel and has a height of 324 meters (1,063 feet).

tours.title: Louvre Museum skip the line
tours.description: Explore the masterpiece of the Louvre with this skip-the-line tour. Meet your driver and guide at your hotel to visit this cultural and historical treasure, which houses an extraordinary collection reflecting the rich artistic heritage of civilizations throughout the ages. The museum's extensive collections include such remarkable works as Leonardo da Vinci's 'Mona Lisa,' the ancient Greek statue 'Venus de Milo,' or the painting 'Liberty Leading the People' by Eugène Delacroix.

tours.title: Opera Garnier Treasures Tour
tours.description: An incredible walking tour of the Palais Garnier, designed by architect Charles Garnier and inaugurated in 1875. The building is a masterpiece of Second Empire architecture, characterized by its opulent decoration, grand staircase adorned with marble, bronze and crystal, and ornate interiors. The auditorium is known for its lavish decor, including a large chandelier and a ceiling painted by Marc Chagall in the 1960s. The opera house hosts ballets, operas, and other performances.

tours.title: The Glamour of Paris: Perfume, lunch, music & cruise
tours.description: Experience the glamour of Paris accompanied by a local guide. Set at the Opera quarter, the Musée du Parfum Fragonard is a charming place dedicated to fragrance unveiling every stage of the making of a mythical object: the French perfume. After this olfactory journey, delight your ears at the Musée de la Musique located in an exceptional architectural ensemble. Six chapters take visitors through the history of music in Europe and around the world. Live performances take place every day at the Museum. Indulge in a gastronomic experience at a typical Parisian restaurant and relax on a 1-hour shared sightseeing cruise along the River Seine.

tours.title: Walking guided city tour
tours.description: Explore the historic city of Caen with your private local guide. Immerse yourself in the fascinating history and heritage of this interesting city known for its monuments such as the imposing Caen Castle built by William the Conqueror in the 11th century, the Abbaye aux Hommes and Abbaye aux Dames, two significant Romanesque abbeys. Stroll through the medieval streets with halftimbered houses and admire the sculptures and moldings on the façades. Caen suffered heavy damage during World War II but has since been rebuilt and is now a vibrant cultural and educational hub, home to several universities and research institutions.

tours.title: Walking guided city tour
tours.description: Embark on a delightful stroll through the enchanting town of Honfleur with a friendly local guide. This picturesque coastal town of Normandy is renowned for its charming harbor, colorful buildings and historic streets. Honfleur has been a source of inspiration for many artists, including painters such as Claude Monet and Eugene Boudin who were attracted by its unique light and scenery. The area around the harbor is filled with narrow cobblestone streets and half-timbered houses, creating a timeless atmosphere.

tours.title: Walking guided city tour
tours.description: Accompanied by your expert local guide, follow the banks of the river Aure where the wheels of the water-mills bear witness to the labour of centuries. Explore the ecclesiastical quarter, where through the ages bishops and canons have worked to complete and preserve the marvelous Cathedral that dominates the town. Admire some of the more aristocratic residences, a step away from the main streets where merchants have plied their trade since time immemorial.

tours.title: Calvados and cider tasting and tickets to Tapestry museum
tours.description: A walk through Bayeux is a walk through time. Explore the icons of this lovely town with your expert local guide. Enjoy a Calvados and cider tasting and visit the Tapestry Museum to admire its unique masterpiece, a remarkable medieval embroidery depicting the events leading up to the Norman conquest of England.

Then, a stop at Monaco old town and the picturesque Port Hercules followed by a stroll through the glamorous heart of Monte Carlo will allow you to experience a glimpse of luxury.

tours.title: Walking guided city tour
tours.description: This walking tour will give you a taste of Lyon's history, culture and architecture, allowing you to experience the city like a local. You will admire the UNESCO-listed Old Town strolling with your private guide. The historic area of Old Lyon, at the foot of the Fourviere hill, is famous for its Renaissance architecture, narrow cobblestone streets, and traboules (hidden passageways) that allow passing from one street to another crossing one or more buildings. In addition to being shortcuts for citizens, the traboules have also played important strategic roles: as a refuge during wars and revolts. The Old Lyon is also home to many charming shops, restaurants, and cafes.

options.name_option: Local guide for 2 hrs. Price per guide

tours.title: River Saone-Promenade Boat Cruise by day
tours.description: Discover Lyon on a 1-hour river cruise along the Saône river. This promenade cruise will allow you to admire the city's architecture and landscapes while enjoying commentary about the history and culture of Lyon. The city consists of three large metropolitan areas: the Fourvière, also called the hill that prays, because of the presence of the great basilica, the Croix-Rousse, or the hill that works, because of its history of textile workers, and the Presqu'Ile, the peninsula created by the intersection of the two rivers, Rhone and Saône, which also includes the old town. A scenic way to experience Lyon from a unique angle and a relaxing journey along the river!

Learn about the history of the area, visit the famous Cours Saleya market and discover landmarks such as the Nice Cathedral and the Lascaris Palace. Take a leisurely stroll along the iconic Promenade des Anglais, which stretches along the Mediterranean coastline. Enjoy panoramic views of the sea, learn about the history of the promenade and discover landmarks such as the Hotel Negresco and the Albert I Garden.

options.name_option: Local guide for 3 hrs. Price per guide

tours.title: Eze, Monaco & Monte Carlo day trip
tours.description: Escape from Nice and admire the Mediterranean coast and its iconic villages with this private day trip. We will stop at Eze, a beautiful village perched high on a cliff overlooking the French Riviera with many artisan workshops. You will visit the Fragonard perfume factory to learn about the process of extracting essential oils. Then, a stop at Monaco old town and the picturesque Port Hercules followed by a stroll through the glamorous heart of Monte Carlo will allow you to experience a glimpse of luxury.

options.name_option: Van with english speaking driver. Price per van

tours.title: French Riviera markets, countryside & lunch day trip
tours.description: Discover the gorgeous landscapes, culinary finesse and artistic heritage of the French Riviera countryside. Immerse yourself in the region's natural beauty, picturesque landscapes of vineyards and olive groves dotted with charming villages. Exploring the markets of the French Riviera is a delightful way to experience the region's vibrant culture. Each market has its own atmosphere and specialties and you can get a taste of the area's culinary richness by enjoying a gourmet lunch at a local restaurant.

options.name_option: Van with english speaking driver. Price per van
Gourmet lunch 3 courses with wine. Price per pax

tours.title: Beaujolais wine region half day trip
tours.description: Beaujolais is France's best kept tourist secret. Explore with your private car and driver this picturesque area of beautiful landscapes, charming hills and slopes covered with vineyards and authentic villages. This fertile region around Lyon is renowned for its production of Beaujolais wine, particularly Beaujolais Nouveau, a light-bodied red wine made from the Gamay grape variety. You will visit a traditional winery and taste 4 wines.

options.name_option: Car/Van with english speaking driver. Price per car/van
Traditional local winery & 4 wines tasting. Price per pax

tours.title: Beaujolais wine region full day trip
tours.description: Explore with your private car and driver this picturesque area of beautiful landscapes, charming hills and slopes covered with vineyards and authentic villages. This tour offers you the opportunity to explore the countryside, visit a traditional winery, taste the renowned Beaujolais wines and learn about the winemaking process. A gastronomic stop is foreseen to have lunch at a typical restaurant.

options.name_option: Car/Van with english speaking driver. Price per car/van
Traditional local winery & 4 wine tastings. Price per pax
Gourmet lunch 3 courses with wine. Price per pax

tours.title: Night Boat Cruise with dinner
tours.description: Admire the beautiful architecture located at the confluence of 2 rivers on a comfortable night cruise and discover Lyon by night while enjoying a delicious dinner. Indulge in quality gastronomy and discover a enriching reading of the landscape thanks to the commentary broadcast during the navigation. With a professional and attentive service as well as a cuisine that favors fresh and seasonal products cooked on board by the chef and his brigade, this experience will be unique. A gourmet outing you will not forget!

tours.title: Walking guided city tour and wine tasting
tours.description: Explore the icons of the wine capital with private local guide and enjoy the flavors for which the region is famous with winery visit and tasting in Beaune. This picturesque town is renowned for its wine production, particularly its red wines made from Pinot Noir grapes and its white wines made from Chardonnay grapes. Beaune is also famous for its annual wine auction held at the Hospices de Beaune, a historic hospital complex with a distinctive multi-colored tile roof.

tours.title: Côte de Nuits & Côte de Beaune day trip
tours.description: Travel to the heart of the Côte de Nuits and Côte de Beaune wine regions, explore villages and stop at 3 family-owned wineries. You will be accompanied by a wine expert guide who will introduce you to the grapes, terroirs and climates of Burgundy. You will enjoy an explanation of the work in the vineyard throughout the year and all its secrets. The tastings (about 18 wines tasted) are exclusive and private. The gastronomic experience will be at a traditional restaurant (one of the best in the area) or at a family-run winery.

options.name_option: Full day package / Price per package

tours.title: Bordeaux Walking guided city tour
tours.description: Visit the city of Bordeaux with a passion local guide for history, but also culture, whose goal is to help you discover some of the wonders of this city. The historic center of Bordeaux is a UNESCO World Heritage Site, celebrated for its elegant 18th-century architecture. Highlights include the Place de la Bourse, a magnificent square facing the Garonne River, and the Grand Theatre de Bordeaux, an exquisite neoclassical opera house. The city also features beautiful public gardens, such as the Jardin Public and the Parc Bordelais.

tours.title: Bordeaux tour by Citroen 2CV
tours.description: Experience a fun and lighthearted sightseeing tour in a vintage Citroën 2CV car. This classic French car is known for its unique design and has become an iconic symbol of France. One of the highlights of the Citroën 2CV is its convertible roof which allows you to enjoy an open-top experience and take in the sights and sounds of Bordeaux in a unique way. The knowledgeable drivers often share interesting anecdotes, historical facts, and local insights about the places.

options.name_option: 2CV tour. Price per car (1h30min)
2CV tour & wine tasting. Price per car (3h)

tours.title: Provence region day trip
tours.description: Discover Provençal villages, markets and the historic towns of Arles, Les Baux and Saint-Rémy-de-Provence. Provence is characterized by its picturesque landscapes, including rolling vineyards, olive groves, lavender fields, sun-drenched hills and charming villages. The region's natural beauty has inspired artists, writers, and travelers for centuries. During this tour you will visit a beautiful wine estate.

options.name_option: Car/Van with english speaking driver. Price per car/van
Full day package / Price per pax

tours.title: Marseille Sightseeing tour with english speaking driver
tours.description: From your hotel by luxury car, enjoy a 3-hour sightseeing tour with our English-speaking driver who will show you the highlights of Marseille such as the Old Port, the historic heart of Marseille and a focal point of the city, the Fort Saint-Jean, the Basilica Notre-Dame de la Garde and the historic district of Le Panier.

options.name_option: Car/Van with english speaking driver. Price per car/van

tours.title: Marseille Walking guided city tour
tours.description: Marseille is a vibrant port city and its strategic location has made it an important hub for trade, culture and maritime activities throughout history. Experience its bustling atmosphere with your local guide, who will allow you to discover its cultural heritage, admire historic landmarks such as the Old Port (Vieux-Port), the cityscape with the Basilica Notre-Dame de la Garde and the district of Le Panier. A glimpse into daily life in Marseille!

tours.title: Provence region day trip
tours.description: Discover the historic provençal towns of Les Baux-de-Provence and Avignon. This mediterranean region is famous for its picturesque countryside, characterized by rolling hills, vineyards, olive groves, and lavender fields. Provence has also a rich history dating back to ancient times, with influences from the Greeks, Romans and various medieval civilizations. Enjoy a wine tasting at Châteauneuf-du-Pape.

options.name_option: Car/Van with english speaking driver. Price per car/van
Full day package / Price per pax

tours.title: Côte de Nuits, wines & countryside trip
tours.description: Journey into the heart of the Côte de Nuits wine region, explore villages and stop at 2 family-run wineries. You will be accompanied by a wine expert guide who will share his passion for Burgundy explaining all the particularities of this beautiful region's terroirs and their climates. From Dijon to Comblanchien, this land of just a few hundred meters gives birth to the finest Pinot Noir wines. The unique complexity of the soil, combining clay and limestone, provides the best terroirs for 24 prestigious red grand cru appellations.

options.name_option: Van with english speaking driver. Price per car/van
Visit 2 family run wineries and 2 tastings. Price per pax

tours.title: Côte de Beaune, wines & countryside trip
tours.description: Journey into the heart of the Côte de Beaune wine region, explore villages and stop at 2 family-run wineries. You will be accompanied by a wine expert guide who will share his passion for Burgundy explaining all the particularities of this beautiful region's terroirs and their climates. The soil of the Côte de Beaune includes stony, clayey, limestone soils, colored by ferruginous salts, marly limestone and also light loams. While it is true that the Côte de Beaune produces the great red wines of Volnay, Pommard, Beaune and Aloxe Corton, it is also in this region that the best white wines of Burgundy are produced.

tours.title: Historic guided walking city tour
tours.description: Dijon was the home of the Dukes of Burgundy and a place of power between the 11th to 15th centuries. On this tour, you will stroll through the historical heart of Dijon enjoying a wealth of architectural treasures such as the Palais des Ducs et des États de Bourgogne (Palace of the Dukes of Burgundy), a grand Renaissance palace housing the Musée des Beaux-Arts (Museum of Fine Arts). The historic city center is filled with well-preserved medieval and Renaissance buildings, picturesque squares, and narrow cobblestone streets.

tours.title: Walking guided city tour
tours.description: Immerse yourself in the history of Reims, a city associated with the coronation of French kings and the Champagne. The 13th-century Cathedral of Notre-Dame de Reims, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, is one of the most famous landmarks in the city. Strolling with your private local guide you will discover the atmosphere of the city imbued by the elegance of Art Deco façades, the beautiful architecture and the fascinating history.

tours.title: Moët & Chandon Champagne experience day tour
tours.description: Champagne tasting at Moët & Chandon is a not-to-be-missed experience for connoisseurs of French bubbly. Meet your english speaking driver-guide, specialized in the Champagne region, at your hotel in Reims. After a comfortable journey in your private car, you will join a shared visit at Champagne Moët & Chandon cellar with guided tasting of 2 champagnes. You will continue with a private tour and tasting at the domain of a premium Family Champagne Producer. During the day you will admire UNESCO World Heritage sites such as the Champagne scenic road, the Avenue de Champagne in Epernay or Hautvillers, the village of the monk Dom Perignon.

tours.title: Sightseeing tour with english speaking driver
tours.description: From your hotel in a private car/van, enjoy a 3-hour sightseeing tour with our English-speaking driver who will show you the highlights of Strasbourg such as the iconic Cathedral of Our Lady of Strasbourg, a masterpiece of Gothic architecture, the city's half-timbered houses, its picturesque canals and several European institutions including the European Parliament, the Council of Europe and the European Court of Human Rights.

options.name_option: Car/Van with english speaking driver. Price per car/van

tours.title: Walking guided city tour
tours.description: A stroll through the streets and corners of Colmar will make you feel as if you have traveled back in time. With your enthusiastic guide, you will discover the charming streets of this Little Venice crossed by the river 'La Lauch' and its emblematic monuments. The colourful half-timbered houses were once inhabited by fishermen, boatmen and market gardeners. They all had one goal in mind: to be different from the rest, to stand out in this medieval architectural parnassus.

tours.title: Cheese and wine tasting
tours.description: Participating in a cheese and wine tasting in Bordeaux is an excellent way to experience the rich culinary heritage of the region. Bordeaux is renowned for its world-class wines and produces a variety of cheeses that pair wonderfully with them. The host or sommelier will provide insights into each cheese and wine, including their flavor profiles, origins and recommended pairings. Bordeaux wines, known for their complexity and depth, pair well with a variety of cheeses, including soft, creamy cheeses like Brie, semi-soft cheeses like Tomme de Bordeaux and hard cheeses like Comté.

tours.title: Saint-Émilion vineyards with wine tasting & lunch
tours.description: Discover winemaking secrets of Saint-Émilion region, famous for its high-quality red wines, primarily made from Merlot and Cabernet Franc grapes. The region is classified as a UNESCO World Heritage Site for its cultural landscape and viticultural history. The charming medieval village of Saint-Émilion is also distinguished by its miles of underground galleries in which the finest wines are aged.

options.name_option: Car/Van with english speaking driver. Price per car/van
Cheese and wine tasting. Price per pax

tours.meeting_point: Pick up from Bordeaux city center hotels.

tours.title: Arcachon & Dune du Pilat day trip
tours.description: Discover several facets of the Arcachon Basin, about 55 kilometers west of Bordeaux. This expanse of salt water separated from the Atlantic Ocean by a strip of sand running along the coast, offers magnificent sea views and a relaxing atmosphere. During this day trip, you will discover the beautiful coastline, the port of La Teste and the Landes forest enjoying an oyster tasting and a private boat ride in the Arcachon Bay. You will also admire the natural wonder of the Dune du Pilat formed by sand deposits under the influence of winds and tides.

options.name_option: Car/Van with english speaking driver. Price per car/van

tours.description: Beaujolais is France's best kept tourist secret. Explore with your private car and driver this picturesque area of beautiful landscapes, charming hills and slopes covered with vineyards and authentic villages. This fertile region around Lyon is renowned for its production of Beaujolais wine, particularly Beaujolais Nouveau, a light-bodied red wine made from the Gamay grape variety. You will visit a traditional winery and taste 4 wines.

tours.description: Admire the beautiful architecture located at the confluence of 2 rivers on a comfortable night cruise and discover Lyon by night while enjoying a delicious dinner. Indulge in quality gastronomy and discover a enriching reading of the landscape thanks to the commentary broadcast during the navigation. With a professional and attentive service as well as a cuisine that favors fresh and seasonal products cooked on board by the chef and his brigade, this experience will be unique. tours.title: Walking guided city tour and wine tasting

This picturesque town is renowned for its wine production, particularly its red wines made from Pinot Noir grapes and its white wines made from Chardonnay grapes. Beaune is also famous for its annual wine auction held at the Hospices de Beaune, a historic hospital complex with a distinctive multi-colored tile roof.

tours.title: Walking guided city tour
tours.description: Explore the icons of the capital of Normandy with a private local guide and a walking tour around the main areas and corners of the city. Rouen is historically significant, known for its stunning Gothic architecture, including the famous Rouen Cathedral painted by Claude Monet. The city has a rich history dating back to Roman times and has played a prominent role in French history, particularly during the Hundred Years' War. Rouen is also known for its picturesque old town, its charming streets, and its association with figures such as Joan of Arc, who was executed in the city in 1431.

tours.title: WW II D-Day, battle of Normandy Beaches day trip
tours.description: Step into the past with this Normandy tour. Nearly 3,000 Allied servicemen, mostly soldiers, lost their lives on D-Day, June 6, 1944. Explore the historic D-Day sites to learn where and how the conflict took place. Since then, the D-Day landing Beaches have become a symbol of the price of peace around the world.

tours.title: Walking guided city tour
tours.description: Explore the historic city of Caen with your private local guide. Immerse yourself in the fascinating history and heritage of this interesting city known for its monuments such as the imposing Caen Castle built by William the Conqueror in the 11th century, the Abbaye aux Hommes and Abbaye aux Dames, two significant Romanesque abbeys. Stroll through the medieval streets with halftimbered houses and admire the sculptures and moldings on the façades. Caen suffered heavy damage during World War II but has since been rebuilt and is now a vibrant cultural and educational hub, home to several universities and research institutions.

tours.title: Walking guided city tour
tours.description: Embark on a delightful stroll through the enchanting town of Honfleur with a friendly local guide. This picturesque coastal town of Normandy is renowned for its charming harbor, colorful buildings and historic streets. Honfleur has been a source of inspiration for many artists, including painters such as Claude Monet and Eugene Boudin who were attracted by its unique light and scenery. The area around the harbor is filled with narrow cobblestone streets and half-timbered houses, creating a timeless atmosphere.

tours.title: Walking guided city tour
tours.description: Accompanied by your expert local guide, follow the banks of the river Aure where the wheels of the water-mills bear witness to the labour of centuries. Explore the ecclesiastical quarter, where through the ages bishops and canons have worked to complete and preserve the marvelous Cathedral that dominates the town. Admire some of the more aristocratic residences, a step away from the main streets where merchants have plied their trade since time immemorial.

tours.title: Calvados and cider tasting and tickets to Tapestry museum

Paris is often referred to as the 'City of Light' (La Ville Lumière) due to its historical importance in the Age of Enlightenment and its early adoption of street lighting. The Seine River flows through the heart of Paris and its banks are dotted with picturesque bridges and monuments. tours.description: Explore the icons of Avignon with a private local guide walking around the main areas and corners of this UNESCO World Heritage Site. It's known for its well-preserved medieval ramparts and its famous bridge, Pont Saint-Bénézet. The city is also renowned for the Palais des Papes (Palace of the Popes), a huge Gothic palace that served as the residence of the popes during the 14th century. Avignon is culturally rich, hosting the Avignon Festival, one of the most important contemporary performing arts events in the world.

tours.title: Tours walking guided city tour
tours.description: Discover the city of Tours led by your knowledgeable private guide. Enjoy a pleasant walk combining historical facts and anecdotes about Tourangelle cuisine. The historic center of Tours is characterized by its narrow medieval streets, half-timbered houses and charming squares. Place Plumereau, in particular, is very popular and lined with cafes and restaurants. Monuments such as the impressive Gothic cathedral of Saint Gatien or the medieval castle overlooking the Loire river give the city its own character.

options.name_option: Local guide for 3 hrs. Price per guide*

tours.title: Château de Chambord skip the line
tours.description: Discover the Château de Chambord, full of mystery thanks to the extraordinary architecture imagined for the glory of Francis I and over which floats the spirit of Leonardo da Vinci. This unique Chateau is known for its elaborate architecture blending traditional French medieval forms with classical Renaissance structures. One of its most famous features is its double helix staircase that allows two people to ascend or descend without meeting each other, as the two helices never intersect.

Enjoy delicious tastings carefully tailored to the season and gain insight into France's culinary culture and heritage.

tours.title: Paris French wine and cheese tasting
tours.description: Enjoy an immersive experience in the wonderful world of wine on this tasting tour in Paris. During your 1.5-hour tasting experience, your host - an expert 'caviste' - takes you on a journey into traditional French winemaking. Taste three varieties of wine and two types of cheese, understand of the importance of terroir and learn how to pair different wines and cheeses for appealing flavor combinations that suit your palate.
tours.observations: Shared activity. Min. 2 pax / Max. 8 pax. Non-operating: 19, 28 & 29 Apr, 01 May, 10 & 14 Jul.

tours.title: Paris Wine Museum with gourmet french lunch
tours.description: At the bend of the Trocadero, discover in a sumptuous mansion of the 17th century, the Wine Museum and its permanent exhibition, its restaurant, wine bar and its tasting rooms. Initiate yourself to the art of wine tasting or learn how to make your own wine! The Museum, an exceptional permanent collection of more than 2200 objects, presented in a historic place of more than 1000 m2 and incredibly preserved: the old quarries and vaulted rooms of the convent of Passy which were exploited in the 13th and 18th centuries.

After a comfortable journey in your private car, you will join a shared visit at Champagne Moët & Chandon cellar with guided tasting of 2 champagnes. You will continue with a private tour and tasting at the domain of a premium Family Champagne Producer. During the day you will admire UNESCO World Heritage sites such as the Champagne scenic road, the Avenue de Champagne in Epernay or Hautvillers, the village of the monk Dom Perignon.

tours.title: Walking guided city tour

With your enthusiastic guide, you will discover the charming streets of this Little Venice crossed by the river 'La Lauch' and its emblematic monuments. The colourful half-timbered houses were once inhabited by fishermen, boatmen and market gardeners. They all had one goal in mind: to be different from the rest, to stand out in this medieval architectural parnassus.

tours.title: Walking guided city tour
tours.description: Explore the icons of Avignon with a private local guide walking around the main areas and corners of this UNESCO World Heritage Site. It's known for its well-preserved medieval ramparts and its famous bridge, Pont Saint-Bénézet. The city is also renowned for the Palais des Papes (Palace of the Popes), a huge Gothic palace that served as the residence of the popes during the 14th century. Avignon is culturally rich, hosting the Avignon Festival, one of the most important contemporary performing arts events in the world.

options.name_option: Local guide for 3 hrs. Price per guide*

tours.title: Van Gogh Tour
tours.description: Be inspired by Van Gogh's Provence on this tour from Avignon, learn how the region's extraordinary light influenced his work. See the locations depicted in 'Starry Night Over the Rhone' and 'Café Terrace' as you explore Arles, then visit Saint-Rémy-de-Provence where the artist was hospitalized for more than a year in the Saint-Paul de Mausole monastery-turned-psychiatric hospital. Surrounded by stunning Provençal countryside, Saint-Rémy-de-Provence offers beautiful landscapes. The Alpilles mountain range provides a dramatic backdrop to the town.

tours.description: A complete vision of Paris in a comfortable private car around the city. Meet your driver at the hotel and enjoy a 3h30min panoramic sightseeing of Paris highlights. Discover the city and admire its major attractions: The Champs-Elysees, Arc de Triomphe, Eiffel Tower, Opera, Trocadero, Invalides, Concorde Square, Vendome Square, Notre-Dame cathedral, Montmartre, Louvre museum, Madeleine church...

options.name_option: Car/Van with english speaking driver. Price per car/van

tours.title: Seine River panoramic cruise
tours.description: See the iconic monuments of Paris from the water on a 1-hour shared sightseeing cruise along the River Seine. Your driver will meet you at the hotel and drop you at embarkment point to enjoy this warm and friendly cruise experience, on comfortable sized boats. This guided cruise offers unique stories, anecdotes and discussions as you discover Paris and its monuments and museums. After the cruise, your driver will take you back to your hotel.

tours.title: Vintage car tour by iconic Citroën 2CV
tours.description: Experience a fun and lighthearted sightseeing tour in a vintage Citroën 2CV car. This classic French car is known for its unique design and has become an iconic symbol of France. One of the highlights of the Citroën 2CV is its convertible roof which allows you to enjoy an open-top experience and take in the sights and sounds of Paris in a unique way. The knowledgeable drivers often share interesting anecdotes, historical facts, and local insights about the places.

tours.title: Walking guided city tour by metro
tours.description: Explore the icons of Paris with a private local guide and a walking tour around the main areas and corners of the city. Paris is often referred to as the 'City of Light' (La Ville Lumière) due to its historical importance in the Age of Enlightenment and its early adoption of street lighting. The Seine River flows through the heart of Paris and its banks are dotted with picturesque bridges and monuments. Feel the Parisian lifestyle and city the rhythm of the city by strolling along its beautiful avenues, streets, gardens and different quarters each with its own personality.

options.name_option: Local guide. Price per guide
Metro ticket 1 day pass (Zone 1-3). Price per pax

tours.title: Beaujolais wine region half day trip
tours.description: Beaujolais is France's best kept tourist secret. Explore with your private car and driver this picturesque area of beautiful landscapes, charming hills and slopes covered with vineyards and authentic villages. This fertile region around Lyon is renowned for its production of Beaujolais wine, particularly Beaujolais Nouveau, a light-bodied red wine made from the Gamay grape variety. You will visit a traditional winery and taste 4 wines.

options.name_option: Car/Van with english speaking driver. Price per car/van
Traditional local winery & 4 wines tasting. Price per pax

tours.title: Beaujolais wine region full day trip
tours.description: Explore with your private car and driver this picturesque area of beautiful landscapes, charming hills and slopes covered with vineyards and authentic villages. This tour offers you the opportunity to explore the countryside, visit a traditional winery, taste the renowned Beaujolais wines and learn about the winemaking process. A gastronomic stop is foreseen to have lunch at a typical restaurant.

options.name_option: Car/Van with english speaking driver. Price per car/van
Traditional local winery & 4 wine tastings. Price per pax
Gourmet lunch 3 courses with wine. Price per pax

tours.title: Night Boat Cruise with dinner
tours.description: Admire the beautiful architecture located at the confluence of 2 rivers on a comfortable night cruise and discover Lyon by night while enjoying a delicious dinner. Indulge in quality gastronomy and discover a enriching reading of the landscape thanks to the commentary broadcast during the navigation. With a professional and attentive service as well as a cuisine that favors fresh and seasonal products cooked on board by the chef and his brigade, this experience will be unique. A gourmet outing you will not forget!

tours.title: Walking guided city tour and wine tasting
tours.description: Explore the icons of the wine capital with private local guide and enjoy the flavors for which the region is famous with winery visit and tasting in Beaune. This picturesque town is renowned for its wine production, particularly its red wines made from Pinot Noir grapes and its white wines made from Chardonnay grapes. Beaune is also famous for its annual wine auction held at the Hospices de Beaune, a historic hospital complex with a distinctive multi-colored tile roof.
tours.observations: Non-operating: Sundays (all year), Fridays (from Dec to Mar) & from 01 to 05 Aug.

tours.title: Lourdes Toulouse day trip
tours.description: Enjoy a day trip to Toulouse and explore its several notable landmarks such as the Basilica of Saint-Sernin, a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the largest Romanesque churches in Europe. Often referred to as the 'Pink City' due to the distinctive terracotta bricks used in many of its buildings, Toulouse is known for its rich history, cultural heritage and vibrant atmosphere. It is also a major center for science and research, famous for its aerospace industry.

options.name_option: Car/Van with english speaking driver. Price per car/van
Local guide in Toulouse (2h). Price per guide

tours.observations: Sundays driver supplement: 175€ / Sundays guide supplement: 20€. Non-operating: Bank Holidays.

tours.title: Amiens Walking guided city tour
tours.description: Explore the icons of the city center, with a private local guide and a walking tour around the main areas and corners of the city. You will learn about the historical background of Amiens main sites: buildings, churches, streets, museums and monuments. Amiens is known for its well-preserved Gothic cathedral, which is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the largest cathedrals in France. Additionally, this interesting city is famous for its hortillonnages, which are floating gardens and marshland area.

tours.title: Lille Walking guided city tour
tours.description: Take the opportunity to soak up the atmosphere of this city renowned for its art of living. Explore the Old Lille district with your private local guide admiring emblematic monuments such as the Palais Rihour, the Vieille Bourse, the Opera House, the Cathedral Notre Dame de la Treille. At the heart of the city is the Grand Place, also known as the Square of General de Gaulle, created in Lille in 1890. Founded in the Middle Ages, it is dedicated to trade, of which the Old Stock Exchange remains the sumptuous symbol.

tours.title: Alsace's 4 Wonders day trip
tours.description: Throughout history, Alsace has been a coveted territory, frequently changing hands between France and Germany. This historical background has contributed to the region's unique identity and cultural heritage. This beautiful region is renowned for its picturesque medieval villages with half-timbered houses, rolling vineyards producing famous wines such as Riesling, Gewürztraminer and Pinot Noir, and its unique cuisine, which combines French and German culinary traditions. You will visit charming villages such as Eguisheim, Kaysersberg, Ribeauvillé and Riquewihr.

Full day package / Price per pax

tours.title: Walking Castle and Ramparts guided tour
tours.description: To visit Carcassonne is a journey back in time to 2500 years ago. Nestled at the top of a hill and located on the right bank of the Aude, the Medieval City dominates the whole city and is said to be one of the best preserved medieval ensembles in the world. Your local guide will reveal you the secrets of this jewel of our history strolling through its charming streets and alleys. The city, still inhabited, has 52 towers and 2 concentric walls totalling 3km of ramparts. You will visit the Chateau Comtal (or Count's Castle), external fortifications and moat...a real immersion in the Middle Ages!

tours.title: Highlights walking guided tour
tours.description: To visit Carcassonne is a journey back in time to 2500 years ago. Nestled at the top of a hill and located on the right bank of the Aude, the Medieval City dominates the whole city and is said to be one of the best preserved medieval ensembles in the world. Your local guide will reveal you the secrets of this jewel of our history strolling through its charming streets and alleys. You will visit the Chateau Comtal (or Count's Castle) and the Romanesque and Gothic-style basilica of Saint Nazaire with its unique carved wooden stalls choir dating back to the 14th century.

Often referred to as the 'Pink City' due to the distinctive terracotta bricks used in many of its buildings, Toulouse is known for its rich history, cultural heritage and vibrant atmosphere.

tours.title: Côte de Nuits & Côte de Beaune day trip
tours.description: Travel to the heart of the Côte de Nuits and Côte de Beaune wine regions, explore villages and stop at 3 family-owned wineries. You will be accompanied by a wine expert guide who will introduce you to the grapes, terroirs and climates of Burgundy. You will enjoy an explanation of the work in the vineyard throughout the year and all its secrets. The tastings (about 18 wines tasted) are exclusive and private. The gastronomic experience will be at a traditional restaurant (one of the best in the area) or at a family-run winery.

options.name_option: Van with english speaking driver

tours.title: Walking guided city tour
tours.description: Visit the city of Bordeaux with a passion local guide for history, but also culture, whose goal is to help you discover some of the wonders of this city. The historic center of Bordeaux is a UNESCO World Heritage Site, celebrated for its elegant 18th-century architecture. Highlights include the Place de la Bourse, a magnificent square facing the Garonne River, and the Grand Theatre de Bordeaux, an exquisite neoclassical opera house. The city also features beautiful public gardens, such as the Jardin Public and the Parc Bordelais.

tours.title: Bordeaux tour by Citroen 2CV

tours.title: Walking guided city tour & Saint-Sernin Basilica
tours.description: Enjoy a historical journey through Toulouse's past. Explore the city's landmarks, architecture and visit the Basilica of Saint-Sernin, a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the largest Romanesque churches in Europe. The building is renowned for its striking architecture, particularly its octagonal bell tower and its Latin cross plan with a nave, transept and multiple chapels. The interior of the basilica is adorned with beautiful frescoes, sculptures and a remarkable Romanesque crypt, which contains the relics of Saint Saturnin.

tours.title: Carcassonne Medieval City & Castle day trip
tours.description: Meet your private driver at your hotel and enjoy a day trip to Carcassonne, a journey back in time to 2500 years ago, a real immersion in the Middle Ages! Nestled at the top of a hill and located on the right bank of the Aude, the Medieval City dominates the whole city and is said to be one of the best preserved medieval ensembles in the world. Your local guide will reveal you the secrets of this jewel of our history strolling through its charming streets and alleys. You will visit the Chateau Comtal (or Count's Castle) and the Romanesque and Gothic-style basilica of Saint Nazaire with its unique carved wooden stalls choir dating back to the 14th century.

tours.title: Walking guided city tour & Sanctuary
tours.description: Explore the city of Lourdes with a guide and learn more about the Marian apparitions in the mid 19th century. According to Catholic belief, the Virgin Mary appeared to a young peasant girl named Bernadette Soubirous several times in a grotto near the town. Lourdes is renowned for its Sanctuary of Our Lady of Lourdes, which includes the Grotto of Massabielle, where the apparitions took place, as well as several churches, basilicas, and healing pools.

tours.title: Pilgrimage half day tour
tours.description: Follow in the footsteps of the peasant girl Bernadette Soubirous to whom the Virgin Mary appeared several times in a grotto near the town around 1858. These apparitions made the place an important pilgrimage destination for Catholics from all over the world. Lourdes is renowned for its Sanctuary of Our Lady of Lourdes, which includes the Grotto of Massabielle, where the apparitions took place, as well as several churches, basilicas, and healing pools.

tours.title: Walking guided city tour
tours.description: Immerse yourself in the history of Reims, a city associated with the coronation of French kings and the Champagne. The 13th-century Cathedral of Notre-Dame de Reims, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, is one of the most famous landmarks in the city. Strolling with your private local guide you will discover the atmosphere of the city imbued by the elegance of Art Deco façades, the beautiful architecture and the fascinating history.
observations: Sundays guide supplement: 75€ / Bank Holidays guide supplement: 150€

tours.title: Moët & Chandon Champagne experience day tour
tours.description: Champagne tasting at Moët & Chandon is a not-to-be-missed experience for connoisseurs of French bubbly. Meet your english speaking driver-guide, specialized in the Champagne region, at your hotel in Reims. After a comfortable journey in your private car, you will join a shared visit at Champagne Moët & Chandon cellar with guided tasting of 2 champagnes. You will continue with a private tour and tasting at the domain of a premium Family Champagne Producer. During the day you will admire UNESCO World Heritage sites such as the Champagne scenic road, the Avenue de Champagne in Epernay or Hautvillers, the village of the monk Dom Perignon.

tours.title: Sightseeing tour with english speaking driver
tours.description: From your hotel in a private car/van, enjoy a 3-hour sightseeing tour with our English-speaking driver who will show you the highlights of Strasbourg such as the iconic Cathedral of Our Lady of Strasbourg, a masterpiece of Gothic architecture, the city's half-timbered houses, its picturesque canals and several European institutions including the European Parliament, the Council of Europe and the European Court of Human Rights.

tours.title: Walking guided city tour
tours.description: A stroll through the streets and corners of Colmar will make you feel as if you have traveled back in time. With your enthusiastic guide, you will discover the charming streets of this Little Venice crossed by the river 'La Lauch' and its emblematic monuments. The colourful half-timbered houses were once inhabited by fishermen, boatmen and market gardeners. They all had one goal in mind: to be different from the rest, to stand out in this medieval architectural parnassus.
